title: Data Analyst, Clinic Business Operations
description:
Overview:

The Data Analyst collaborates with key business partners to understand their information needs and delivers high-quality, high-performing, and intuitive data and reporting solutions focused on specific business domains. Additionally, this role supports, scales, and optimizes our BI, Analytics, and reporting services and plays a leading role in designing and implementing our next-generation data and analytics platform.
Responsibilities:
* Collaborates with business units and stakeholders to identify reporting needs, analyze current procedures, explore opportunities, reduce redundancies, and ensure data gathering and reporting processes support corporate strategies and business objectives
* Synthesizes and analyzes clinical business operations data, interpreting information, participating in the development of recommendations for improvements in a continuous agile partnership, and performing tasks such as assisting in selecting appropriate outcome measures and furthering understanding of the clinical business operations experience and outcome metrics
* Ability to collect, analyze and communicate data in a way easily understood by end users
* Provides detailed analysis, advice, insight, and interpretation from complex data across multiple sources
* Develops and seeks continuous improvement to the performance reporting processes, including report automation and the coordination of reporting inputs, analyses, and distributions
* Provides quality assurance and a value-added review of reporting inputs to promote high standards for quality and insight.
* Ensures the analytics solutions are aligned with the Data Team production standards and guidelines, such as data definitions and UI/UX visualizations
* Communicating the final solution to the business and coordinating the implementation and user training of the solution in the production environment



Qualifications:
**Education & Experience*** Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Data Analytics, or equivalent experience required.
* 5-7 years of relevant experience in decision support, data analysis, performance reporting, and clinical business operations

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities*** Proficient with data visualization and dashboarding tools (Power BI preferred) and familiarity with applicable programming languages (DAX, R, Python)
* Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (T-SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
* Working knowledge of data architecture for data warehousing, reporting, and analytics, primarily with Microsoft Azure data solutions
* Working knowledge with ETL and enterprise analytics tools such as SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) or Power BI Report Server, and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
* Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
* A successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large disconnected datasets
* Working knowledge of DevOps methodologies and practices such as CICD
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to multi-task, focus on detail, set priorities, and work independently
* Above average documentation skills, with requisite attention to detail
* Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and customers to resolve issues and implement business intelligence solutions that meet business needs
* Experience in advanced analytics applying descriptive and predictive analyses and modeling skills using statistical software such as R, text analytics tools and/or other analytical programming languages
* Experience with the Qlik Cloud Data Integration suite

title: Data Annotation Analyst
description:
**About Alaffia & Our Mission**



The U.S. healthcare system suffers from over $300B in improper payments each year due to fraud, waste, abuse, and processing errors. We’re on a mission to change that. To best prevent inaccurate payments, we’ve assembled a team of experienced technologists and industry-leading healthcare domain experts. The Alaffia team has alumni ranging from Amazon, Goldman Sachs, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, and other leading healthcare and financial institutions. We’re also backed by industry-leading venture capital firms!



If you want to make a major impact at the core of U.S. healthcare by implementing the latest in cutting-edge technologies, then we’d like to meet you.

 **Our Culture**



At Alaffia, we fundamentally believe that the whole is more valuable than the sum of its individual parts. Further to that point, we believe a diverse team of individuals with various backgrounds, ideologies, and types of training generates the most value. Our people are entrepreneurial by nature, problem solvers, and are passionate about what they do — both inside and outside of the office.

 **About the Role & What You’ll Be Doing**



As a Data Annotation Analyst at Alaffia Health, where you'll play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and accuracy of our medical claims data. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that claim billing information is accurately reviewed, entered, updated, and processed through our internal systems. This role is essential for maintaining compliance with internal protocols and regulatory standards, contributing directly to the efficiency and effectiveness of our bill review processes. You'll be responsible for accurately inputting and updating claim information, collaborating closely with our Engineering team, and ensuring high-quality data standards are upheld throughout the process. This is a 1099 contractor role.

 **Your Responsibilities**


* Accurate Data Entry: Enter and update patient billing information, treatment codes, insurance details, and billing amounts into our data systems with precision.
* Efficient Data Management: Oversee the smooth flow of data through internal pipelines and applications, ensuring timely and accurate processing.
* Data Verification: Review and verify data for completeness, accuracy, and compliance with established procedures and regulatory requirements.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with the data entry specialist team to resolve discrepancies and maintain accuracy and completeness in billing records.
* Confidentiality: Maintain the confidentiality and security of patient information in accordance with HIPAA and other relevant regulations.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with healthcare providers and insurance companies to gather necessary information and clarify billing details.
* Audit and Quality Control: Conduct regular audits of billing records to identify and correct errors, contributing to data quality improvement efforts.
* Process Improvement: Assist in the development and implementation of data management procedures to enhance data quality and efficiency.
* Reporting and Support: Generate reports and provide data-related support to other departments as needed, leveraging data insights to inform decision-making processes.

  


**What We’re Looking For**


* High school diploma or equivalent required; Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Health Information Technology, Finance, or related field preferred.
* Proven experience as a data entry specialist, preferably in the healthcare sector dealing with medical billing or health information management.
* Proficient in data entry with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
* Familiarity with medical terminology, billing codes (ICD-10, CPT, etc.), and healthcare billing procedures and formats (UB-04, CMS1500, etc.) preferred.
* Strong computer skills. Proficiency in MS Office and experience with electronic health records (EHR) and billing software preferred.
* Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact effectively with colleagues.
* Commitment to maintaining the confidentiality and security of sensitive patient information

title: Data Analyst
description:
At **Fleetworthy Solutions,** our brand reflects an evolution of over three decades of providing compliance services and solutions that exceed state and federal standards through the combination of data, technology and experienced people to improve compliance visibility, and ultimately make the roads safer. We are looking to add a Data Analyst to our team. This position is remote with the preferred home location being in the Midwest or Eastern time zones.

Job Summary:

Your primary job responsibilities will be building dashboards and other analytics driven from core software products, creating solutions for collecting, collating, and storing data from internal and external sources, building simple user interfaces when necessary, and creating repeatable and ad hoc reports or data extracts to serve business needs. Our toolset is Python (Pandas and Flask), SQL, and proprietary REST APIs, as well as dashboarding software. The team’s goal is to improve efficiency while providing context and insights that spur action and decision making at all levels, both internal and external.

This role reports directly to the Data Services Manager as part of a small team inside a larger software and technology division. You will work closely with our product and software development teams.

You will work mostly independently with the opportunity to design your own solutions that integrate with, and add to, existing interfaces as part of projects of different scales, some taking days and others taking months. Examples include cloning internal client data structures for use in experimentation and testing, building calculators based on large data sets and complex algorithms to itemize tax calculations, and reading and comparing source of truth data sets to internal systems to automate applying updates.

Who is Fleetworthy and why should you work here?

Fleetworthy is a technology-supported managed services organization that leverages our data, technology, and subject-matter experts to reduce risk for our customers. Our data and technology teams are growing and there are opportunities to learn, grow, and be a foundational part of the team.

Your responsibilities:

- Develop and generate reports and dashboards from single or multiple systems.

- Develop, automate, and maintain data collection, organization, management, and storage for ad hoc and/or repeated use.

- Extract and transform data from internal systems as well as client and vendor data sets for inclusion in the data warehouse, reports, and dashboards.

- Troubleshoot the reporting database environment and reports and communicate with appropriate teams to remedy issues when needed.

- Process confidential data and information according to established guidelines.

- Manage and maintain the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.

- Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization.

- Evaluate changes and updates to source production systems.

- Document new reports and dashboards and changes to each.

- Provide technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

- Visualize data to be digestible to stakeholders.

- Create and maintain simple UIs for data requests and upload.

- Train end-users and present new features and findings.

Your skills:

- Familiarity with data modeling – relational (3NF) and dimensional.

- Understand how to query and handle large, diverse datasets.

- ETL and ELT.

- Proficiency in T-SQL and Python.

- Familiarity with Dashboarding software (Tableau, Power BI, Sisense, etc.) and the purpose they serve.

- Troubleshooting, critical thinking, and solution building.

- Communicating data and requirements to non-technical stakeholders, and understanding non-technical stakeholders’ needs to gather requirements.

What can make you stand out:

Experience with

- MS Access, MS Excel, and VBA

- Salesforce

- SSIS and SSRS

- Git and code review

- Containerization

Requirements

- Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field or equivalent work experience.

- Authorized to work in the United States.

- Some travel for onsite meetings or client visits (5-10%).

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

* Paid holidays
* Paid time off
* Partner benefits
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Experience level:

* 2 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* ETL & ELT: 1 year (Required)

description:

Drives critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports. Serves as a task lead to plan and design the analysis and then execute the plan. Oversees the process of enhanced reporting development and acquisition of reporting and analysis tools. * 

Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, decomposes high-level information into details, and abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding.  
* 

Documents requirements based on design, cross-functional integration, feasibility studies, and functional process specifications. Assembles, prepares, and analyzes data in respective business area; presents analysis/data to client in support of statement of work. Communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements.  
*

title: Data Specialist
description:
Nudj Health is a unique lifestyle medicine company partnering with health providers to improve the wellness of their patients. We deliver integrated, continuous, and whole person care beyond the walls of the office using evidence-based therapies and interventions at the intersection of physical, mental, behavioral, and social health.

At Nudj, we believe it truly “takes a village” and we have the technology and an innovative multi-disciplinary team of clinical and lifestyle experts including psychiatrists, care managers, wellness guides, dieticians, fitness coaches, and remote device specialists helping patients improve their health and well-being. Our patient centric model is designed to nudge patients from the comfort of their own homes, towards overall wellness, both mind and body, helping reduce the risk of future health issues.

Nudj is growing and evolving quickly. We are looking for dedicated and organized individuals who can be adaptable and flexible and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Join a team of seasoned clinicians and experienced professionals who deeply care about making life-long connections with patients and redefining episodic disease care to true health care.

**The Role**

Under the supervision of the Director of Patient Device and Data Management, the Data Specialist is responsible for transferring large volumes of data into the Nudj database and keeping records current.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

* Transfer data from various Electronic Medical Records into Nudj database
* Update Nudj database with new data as it becomes available
* Create and manage spreadsheets with large amounts of data for internal reporting
* Create new patient enrollment and lab orders and various EMRs
* Ensure compliance with security requirements when transferring and updating data

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent
* At least 3 years of experience in Data Entry or equivalent
* Strong knowledge of and experience in EMRs
* Proficient in Excel and other Office products, and not afraid of new technologies
* A bright, problem-solving mindset and attention to detail (health care is complex and each patient is unique)
* Excellent time management, detail-oriented, highly organized, and the ability to work independently
* Strong interest in healthcare
* Welcomes a team-centric environment, with open feedback and learning

**At Nudj Health, we:**

* Work remotely - our team members work and live all over the United States
* Work-life Balance - PTO, 12 Paid Holidays
* Create Opportunity Paths - Whether you want to continue working with patients, become a supervisor, obtain licensure in additional states, or more...we encourage and support that at Nudj
* A Career, not just a job - Competitive pay with Benefits
* Shared Purpose - Mission first mentality to make a daily positive impact in a patient’s life
* Offer Support & Trust - Mentoring, 1:1 Manager meetings, Team building events (yes, even virtually), and a Leadership team with extensive experience in healthcare

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What EMR/EHR systems do you have experience with?

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 3 years (Required)
* EMR: 2 years (Required)
* healthcare setting: 2 years (Preferred)

title: Data Steward Analyst
description:
As our Data Steward, you will onboard clients into the R1 Data Platform and Application Suite and work closely with the sales team to conduct assessments with potential clients.


Each day, you will identify and understand trends in our client data, resolve weekly data issues, automate processes, create documentation, contribute to process improvement and innovation, and perform ad hoc research for functional counterparts. To thrive in this role, you must have have strong attention to detail and experience working with large data sets in a healthcare environment.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Full client implementations – acquiring data, importing data, validating data, and getting the system ready for go live, managing your own deliverables to timelines.
* Data research and analysis – writing queries, analyzing results, identifying trends.
* Managing a relationship between Client IT or with internal stakeholders to collaboratively work towards data that meets R1’s data specification.
* Applying a deep understanding of healthcare data to solve problems for internal and external stakeholders.
* Presenting results of research to non-technical stakeholders that are both internal and external.
Scripting and automating of data related processes.  
*

* Our ideal candidate is passionate about solving problems with data, detail oriented, collaborative, a great self-learner, and appreciates a workplace culture that balances fun with professionalism.

* 1+ year’s experience in a client facing role (serving internal or external customers okay)

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Experience with healthcare data a strong plus

For this US-based position, the base pay range is $46,971.35 - $74,607.00 per year . Individual pay is determined by role, level, location, job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

title: Entry Level Business Analyst
description:
At Ascensus, technology is more than just a solution. It powers the business that helps millions of people save for what matters—retirement, education, and healthcare. Our technology experts tackle exciting challenges in collaborative teams, but work in an environment where individual and career development is always valued. Technology associates leverage their talents and passion, building new and innovative platforms, creating programs founded in automation in agile frameworks, and driving existing and new markets—all of which supports the rapid growth of a dynamic industry leader.

**Section 1: Position Summary**


Partner with the Product Owner, to understand business needs and its changes. The business analyst must assess the impact of the changes to the product’s system, recording, analyzing and documenting the requirements.

**Section 2: Job Functions, Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Collaborates with Product Owner to write accurate user stories and acceptance criteria, incorporating technical dependencies that are ready to be consumed by the team.
* Supports and educates the Product Owner, especially with respect to grooming and maintaining the product backlog.
* Actively participates in scrum ceremonies Assists the project team in the definition of project deliverables
* Participates in retrospectives, identifying the successes and challenges encountered and being an advocate for positive change.
* Completes the accurate and timely updates as required to time and project tracking systems.
* Maintain documentation, including user guides and system documentation.
* Troubleshoot issues in system environments deployed by the organization.
* Continually enhances own domain knowledge of systems, products, and industry.
* Collaborates with team members to identify and apply best practices.
* Works with Product Owner and Team to plan and execute project implementations.
* Continually improve personal skills and adaptability to agile practice and the practical application of these skills.
* Assists in the identification and mitigation of project risks.
* Brings technical product knowledge to strategic business conversations.
* Assists with other tasks and projects as assigned.
* Responsible for protecting, securing, and proper handling of all confidential data held by Ascensus to ensure against unauthorized access, improper transmission, and/or unapproved disclosure of information that could result in harm to Ascensus or our clients.
* Our I-Client service philosophy and our Core Values of People Matter, Quality First and Integrity Always® should be visible in your actions on a day to day basis showing your support of our organizational culture.

**Supervision**

* N/A

**Section 3: Experience, Skills, Knowledge Requirements**

* Demonstrated success in Business Analyst position or equivalent work experience.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
* Excellent analytical skills.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills including active listening.
* Knowledge of PC applications including SQL and MS Office products.
* Knowledge of common business applications and analytical tools.

**Preferred Skills/Experience:**

* Knowledge and/or experience with writing user stories and acceptance criteria.
* Knowledge of Scrum/Agile theory.
* Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team.


We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

*Be aware of employment fraud. All email communications from Ascensus or its hiring managers originate from @ascensus.com* *or @futureplan.com* *email addresses. We will never ask you for payment or require you to purchase any equipment. If you are suspicious or unsure about validity of a job posting, we strongly encourage you to apply directly through our website.*

title: Business Analyst
description:
Take the next step in your journey at Inspira Financial. You will help businesses and individuals thrive today, tomorrow, and into retirement. Become part of a company that is people centric and client obsessed in every interaction; a community of forward-thinking individuals focused on driving results to deliver our mission with an unwavering commitment to integrity. Join us as we strengthen and simplify the health and wealth journey – relentlessly pursuing better outcomes for all. **We believe in finding the best talent! While some roles are based at one of our office locations, remote roles can sit in any of the following states: AL, AZ, FL, GA, IA, IL, IN, MI, MN, MO, NC, NE, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA and WV. Remote status and role locations are subject to change. Relocation is not provided.**


Don’t meet every single requirement? Here at Inspira Financial, we believe there is no “perfect” candidate and want to encourage applying even if all the requirements listed aren’t met. Our goal is to build an authentic workplace by valuing diversity in our candidates. We work to ensure that our team reflects the diversity of the businesses and clients we serve. We are always looking to expand our growing team with dynamic and enthusiastic individuals. If you enjoy a collaborative, fun environment that champions career development, Inspira Financial is the place for you! We look forward to receiving your application! Check out this Inspira Financial video to learn more about our company!


**HOW YOU WILL SOAR:**

The Business Analyst will be responsible for specification, prioritization, implementation, and acceptance of issues and product features in an agile environment. The product specialist will be accountable to implement and solve issues from clients within the defined SLAs. This role will work closely with product management, customer service, production support, and technology teams to ensure the issue and product feature prioritization aligns with business, customer, and technology outcomes. The ideal candidate will be a problem solver with a solid analytic foundation.


* Tracks and regularly shares progress with stakeholders on open issues, and feature requests
* Synthesizes feature requests and collaborates with product owners to include the requests into product roadmaps
* Identifies and spearheads opportunities to improve support procedures and tracks metrics to reduce the cycle time for issue resolution.
* Contributes to user stories and provides voice of the customer context for the issues and change requests reported by internal and external clients
* Grooms backlog and ensures that stories are ready for development
* Monitors and reports KPIs on product quality and issue turnaround times.
* Collaborates with various business lines and technology to analyze needs, constraints, risks, and alignment with organizational strategy and priorities
* Works in partnership with the team and stakeholders to employ Agile methods, processes, tools, and metrics to deliver value, including ongoing product backlog refinement, and release planning
* Regularly assesses features and costs to determine priorities for the team.
* Responsible for accepting product deliverables and providing guidance to the implementation teams


**IF YOU HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING, APPLY:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Information Technology, Product Development or related field
* 1-3 years of applicable experience
* Strong communication, facilitation and interpersonal skills to connect and engage with the team, facilitate discussions, negotiate with the business, and resolve conflicts
* Solid analytical skills, creative problem-solving skills, and high attention to detail
* Background in Financial Services and Fintech strongly preferred
* Working knowledge with Cloud-based applications and APIs, DevOps, Agile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban).
* Working knowledge of Agile practices and ceremonies such as iterative development, incremental delivery, sprint planning, backlog grooming, retrospectives, burn down metrics, velocity and task definition
* Ability to handle multiple issues simultaneously
* Knowledge of technical concepts and architectural principles to drive scalable solutions.


Inspira Financial provides health, wealth, retirement, and benefits solutions that strengthen and simplify the health and wealth journey. With more than 7 million clients, representing over $62 billion in assets, Inspira works with thousands of employers, plan sponsors, recordkeepers, TPAs, and other institutional partners — helping the people they care about plan, save, and invest for a brighter future. Inspira relentlessly pursues better outcomes for all with our automatic rollover services, health savings accounts, emergency savings funds, custody services, and more. Learn more at inspirafinancial.com.


We have been recognized for our remarkable growth on lists such as Crain’s Fast 50 and Inc. 5000, and for our outstanding workplace culture and benefits with Built In’s 2023 Best Places to Work and Gallagher’s 2022 Best-In-Class Employer awards.


#LI-MG1 #LI-Remote

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Who are we?**



Buyers Edge Platform stands at the forefront of revolutionizing the foodservice industry through cost reducing solutions and data-driven insights. We are dedicated to empowering stakeholders across the entire foodservice ecosystem with efficiency and unprecedented visibility. With a diverse portfolio of over a dozen brands, our mission is clear: to reduce costs, streamline the foodservice supply chain, and propel the industry from manual to automated. Our commitment to foodservice excellence is proven in four distinct areas of value: Digital Procurement Network, Fresh Solutions, Supply Chain Management, and SaaS Software. Buyers Edge Platform is not just a provider – we are a strategic partner on the journey towards a more efficient, connected, and automated future for the foodservice industry.


**This position is remotely based. We are unable to offer work sponsorship for this role.**


**Your impact:**


* Analyze and determine trends such as volume trends, market trends, geographical trends, etc. to share with key decision makers, summarizing into both ad-hoc reports and dashboards
* Have knowledge and understanding of our databases in order to query and summarize data for analyses
* Build and maintain tools to track KPIs and data trends to show impact to various stakeholders (brands, clients, Finance, executives) - and communicate actionable advice
* Optimize time management via SQL, Python, Tableau, etc. (create efficiencies and accuracies in scaling) related to analytics


**About you:**


* Education/Coursework in Data Analytics or related field
* 2+ years industry (or related) work experience
* Proficient Programming and software skills: SQL
* Experience with: Python, Tableau
* Proficient with Microsoft Office, Expertin Microsoft Excel
* Proficient in Salesforce (or related CRM)
* Effectively manage, prioritize, organize team projects/tasks and initiatives
* Team Player – embraces collaboration and contributes to the team's overall success
* Eagerness to independently solve problems and be a part of creating long term solutions
* Strong communication skills to work with cross functional teams and within various levels of management in the organization
* Expert data analytics skills and critical-thinking to analyze, summarize, communicate issues, and drive solutions for stakeholders
* Ability to maintain organization with large sets of data
* Extreme attention to detail
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills

  


**What's in this for you?**

**Amazing coverages to start.** Medical, dental, and vision coverages are just the beginning! We also offer ancillary plans, such as flexible spending accounts for both health and dependent care, critical illness, accident, and voluntary life as well as company paid life and long-term-disability plans! On top of this, we also offer a 401(k) plan with company match.


**Invest in your success.** We will provide you with a thorough training and development program; and offer competitive compensation.


**Live well = Work well.** Relax with our Personal Responsibility Paid Time Off policy where you don't have to accrue time off in order to take it! We also offer half-day Summer Fridays!


We welcome all.



We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.

title: Sales Operations - Data Analyst | Remote MEXICO
description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated Sales Operations Data Analyst to join our team. This is a crucial role in providing actionable insights on sales activities, improving and managing sales processes and data entry, and ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Responsibilities will include understanding Salesforce and supporting processes, data mining using multiple tools like Zoominfo and Salesforce, importing and exporting data, generating data reports, segmenting data, and managing data assignments. You will collaborate closely with the business development, sales, and marketing teams. . Our ideal candidate is highly data-driven, intellectually curious, and a fast learner. They can respond effectively to new situations and quickly identify high-impact projects with limited direction and supervision.


**Responsibilities:**

* Determine appropriate methods to analyze operations, relevant information, and data
* Evaluate and organize data and provide support to the marketing and sales departments
* Maintain accurate prospect and client data throughout CRM
* Integrate, analyze, and evaluate based on predetermined metrics
* Provide ad hoc analyses to sales and marketing teams regarding sales progress and syndicated data updates
* Integrate multiple data sources to address complex business questions and to develop data driven actionable recommendations for the business
* Assist in territory and quota administration, report and dashboard management, basic troubleshooting, and other tasks required
* Leverage technology to remove bottlenecks and increase efficiency
* Cleanse the sourced data to detect and correct inaccurate records
* Map all accounts and contacts based on the defined target criteria
* Import and migrate data of all accounts and contacts of mapped accounts sourced from Zoominfo/Salesforce/LinkedIn Sales Navigator into Outreach
* Segment, report, and assign accounts and contacts to all sales and business development representatives based on defined territories or assigned accounts
* Assist in building new demand-gen campaigns and sequences in Outreach
* Ability to segment contact prospect lead reports by personas and titles


**Technical Skills Required:**


* 5+ years of hands-on experience with Salesforce CRM
* 5+ years of in-depth expertise with Microsoft Excel and Access
* 3+ years of experience in working on Zoominfo or other database platforms
* Experience with Outreach platform is preferred
* Advance proficiency in Excel for data manipulation and complex custom reports, including Vlookup and using pivot tables
* Advanced proficiency with PowerBI is a plus
* Knowledge of LinkedIn Sales Navigator a plus


**Required qualifications, experience, and skills****:**


* Work in the USA time zones
* Extreme attention to detail and consistently seek to understand the cause and effect of a situation thoroughly
* Critical thinking, analytical thinking, problem solving, data analysis, and strategic planning
* Ability to work in a team and independently and meet deadlinesEffective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Highly organized with the ability to work with information from multiple sources, collaboratively in a team environment, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Knowledge of data privacy and security principles is a plus
* Strong personal code of ethics, integrity, diversity, and trust
* Positive energy and a good sense of humor

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Company Overview:**  
Copeck Digital Media Group is a leading data-driven organization dedicated to leveraging analytics to drive informed decision-making and strategic growth. We specialize in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to uncover valuable insights and trends that help our clients achieve their business objectives. As we continue to expand our team, we are seeking a talented and analytical Data Analyst to join us in transforming raw data into actionable insights.

**Position Overview:**  
We are looking for a detail-oriented and results-driven Data Analyst who is passionate about uncovering insights from complex datasets. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistics, and programming, along with the ability to translate data into meaningful business recommendations. From data collection to visualization to reporting, the Data Analyst will play a critical role in helping our organization and clients make data-driven decisions.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collect, clean, and organize large datasets from various sources, ensuring data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
* Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within the data, using statistical methods and visualization techniques.
* Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and measure business outcomes.
* Conduct predictive modeling, forecasting, and regression analysis to uncover insights and make data-driven predictions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, data engineers, and software developers, to define data requirements and implement solutions.
* Interpret and communicate findings from data analysis to non-technical stakeholders, providing actionable insights and recommendations for decision-making.
* Stay up-to-date on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and visualization.
* Continuously monitor and evaluate data quality and integrity, identifying and addressing issues as they arise.
* Participate in the design and implementation of data governance policies and procedures to ensure data security, privacy, and compliance.
* Support ad-hoc data analysis requests and special projects as needed, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic work environment.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role, with a strong background in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages, such as SQL, Python, R, or MATLAB.
* Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw actionable insights.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical language.
* Detail-oriented mindset and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Team player with strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Continuous learner with a passion for exploring new technologies, techniques, and methodologies in data analysis.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
* Opportunities for professional development and training.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Opportunity to work on exciting projects and make a meaningful impact through data-driven insights.

If you are a skilled and analytical Data Analyst looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity to work with a dynamic team and drive data-driven decision-making, we encourage you to apply today! Please submit your resume, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio or examples of past data analysis projects.

* 3 years

title: Data Conversion Analyst
description:
**Why Springbrook:**
--------------------


Over 2800 local government agencies trust Springbrook solutions. Springbrook develops true cloud-based government ERP financial software, with our flagship ERP Cirrus, representing the most modern and secure platform in the market. Our fully integrated suite of cloud-based solutions are intuitive and continually evolving, with input from local governments and water, sewage, and fire districts in cities, towns, and municipalities from coast to coast. Springbrook's industry-leading finance, payroll, utility billing, payments, cash receipting, and tax collection modules are proven safe, reliable, scalable and designed for the needs of communities from 300-100,000.


Our employees experience a culture that emphasizes performance, productivity, and collaboration. You will be empowered and engaged, working with like-minded individuals who are driven and passionate about contributing to a market-leading software organization with proven technology. While we are busy changing the world, we also strongly believe in having fun and excitement at work and encouraging a collaborative and healthy work-life balance. We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits.


If you are motivated by the idea of delivering on the promise of solving for a new era of more efficient, open, and innovative governance, then we would love to talk with you. This position offers the flexibility for you to work from any location within the United States remotely.

**Where You Fit:**
------------------

The Data Conversion Specialist works with the team to develop and execute data conversion plans. We are looking for someone to build repeatable, robust processes that require minimum changes on subsequent conversion activities.


This position offers the flexibility for you to work from any location within the United States remotely.


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Analyze, map, and convert data from various sources into a structured format.
* Gather and translate business requirements into conversion requirements.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data transformation needs and project alignment across the software modules.
* Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues to assure accuracy and completeness of converted data. Ensure compliance with data privacy and security policies.
* Stay current with new software releases and features and provide data transformation recommendations when needed.
* Develop and maintain data conversion documentation, including mapping documents, conversion scripts, and validation plans.
* Maintain general awareness of Springbrook security and privacy policies
* Report any security incident or suspected security incident to the Springbrook Incident Response Team

**Required Qualifications:**
----------------------------

* Minimum five years' experience as a Data Conversion Specialist including experience gathering business requirements, leading design sessions, configuring, testing, and moving to production activities.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field or an additional two years of relevant Data Conversion experience
* Proven track record in a data conversion role
* Demonstrated experience in software data conversion, data migration, and/or data mapping.
* High level of proficiency and knowledge of how to interact and pull data from multiple different data formats such as Oracle, SQL, MySQL, Flat File (CSV, XML, etc).
* Strong experience in ETL tools such as SSIS and Talend.
* Strong problem-solving, analytical, and social skills.
* Must be comfortable speaking with non-technical resources in requirements gathering.
* Excellent communication and people skills.

*Applicants must have the unrestricted ability to work in the United States (sponsorship will not be offered)*

*Springbrook Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Springbrook does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a meticulous and experienced Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing our master data set, developing insightful reports, and resolving data-related challenges. The ideal candidate will possess a keen attention to detail, substantial experience in data analysis, and a proficient understanding of popular data analysis tools and databases.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage master data, overseeing its creation, updates, and deletion processes.
* Administer user roles and permissions effectively.
* Ensure the quality assurance of imported data, collaborating with quality assurance analysts as needed.

* Process confidential data and information according to established guidelines and protocols.

* Design and manage the reporting environment, encompassing data sources, security measures, and metadata management.
* Collaborate with the data warehouse team to identify and address reporting requirements.
* Support initiatives aimed at enhancing data integrity and normalization.
* Assess and implement new software solutions, contributing to strategic decisions regarding system upgrades.
* Generate reports from various systems, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
* Troubleshoot issues within the reporting database environment and rectify discrepancies.
* Evaluate changes and updates to source production systems, ensuring compatibility and continuity.
* Conduct training sessions for end-users on new reports and dashboards.
* Provide technical expertise in areas such as data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field from an accredited university or college.
* Proven work experience as a data analyst or in a similar role.
* Strong ability to collaborate with stakeholders to assess potential risks and requirements.
* Proficiency in analyzing existing tools and databases, with the ability to offer software solution recommendations.
* Capacity to translate complex business requirements into clear, non-technical terms.
* Extensive experience with methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.
* Demonstrated proficiency in handling large data sets and relational databases.
* Understanding of data addressing and metadata standards.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts effectively.

description:

**Prescreening Questions:**

* What is the largest file size you have manipulated as a Data Analyst?
* Tell me about your process when troubleshooting data-related service requests?

**Role Overview**:

* This role will work with senior managers and executive sponsors to initiate and lead data management projects and programs supporting strategic business in Global Workplace Solutions (GWS). This is predominantly mobilizing new client accounts and expansion/transformation of existing accounts. This individual will collaborate with a cross-functional team of subject matter expert (SMEs) resources charged with establishing operational capability for service delivery teams.
* The purpose of this position is to provide complex research, system data management/analysis, reporting, and coordination of data for client outsourcing programs.

**Day to Day Responsibilities:**

* Back-end data support – sole point person for back-end data management and analysis on client projects (9 in flight currently)
* Data modeling for dashboard/user stories
* Extraction of data to support management decisions.
* Aggregate PDFs, Word documents, Excel sheets, etcs to central SQL database
* Troubleshoot and correct data-related service requests, track request progress.
* Investigate, analyze and problem-solve
* Work directly with GTT stakeholders to onboard new clients
* Work with involved stakeholders to develop/update onboarding processes, tools, dashboards, and templates.
* Provide post-launch data support to client success teams; answer any questions and assist in problem resolution.
* Work with stakeholders to develop and maintain tools for maintaining database integrity
* Partner with project data lead, including oversight of Data Governance and Data Management activities, in the coordination of the SME (Subject Matter Expert) and analyst resources to successfully collect and refine data necessary to complete specified projects.

**Years’ Experience Required:**

* 2 – 4

**Education Requirements**:

* Bachelor’s Degree required

**Systems/Software Proficiencies**:

* SQL, Power BI, Alteryx

**Certifications:**

* Microsoft Data Engineer or Scientist Associate preferred

**Must have Skills**:

* Back-end data support - extraction of data to support management decisions.
* Data modeling and data visualization tools
* Data management tools
* Superb communication - Ability to communicate and collaborate with broad audiences
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills – ability to think outside of the box

**Top Nice to Have Skills:**

* Microsoft Data Engineer or Scientist Associate preferred

**Interview Process:**

* 2 Rounds – 1st Video w/HM; 2nd Video w/HM + 1 and another Engineer

* Health insurance

title: Master Data Analyst- Grand Rapids, MI/Hybrid or Remote
description:
**COMPANY DESCRIPTION**


At AirLife, we are dedicated to improving the quality of every breath. *Excellence with Every Breath* is not just a tag line, but the way we work and take care of our customers. With a mindset to evolve, innovate, and grow, we are a premier manufacturer of the highest-quality and market-leading breathing consumables. This growth philosophy has positioned us to increase our global footprint and business reach, impacting even more people around the world. Our expanding family of the most trusted brands offers a product portfolio that spans the continuum of care from first responder to home care, with safety, patient comfort, and clinical performance in mind. Collective expertise allows us to provide quality products and experiences to our patients, customers, and our people. Our values of Customer first, Differentiate with our People, Bias for Action, Continuous Improvement and Accountability define who we are and how we work. Join us!

**POSITION SUMMARY**


The Master Data Analyst will support AirLife by monitoring and analyzing master data, key data, and master relationship data within the organization.

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**


The specific minimum competencies needed to perform the essential duties of the job include knowledge, skills, abilities, level of education, and experience necessary for successful performance. These competencies are generally demonstrated through specific service, education, or training.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of customer and product master data.
* Conducts data cleansing to rid the system of old, unused data, or duplicate data.
* Responsible for understanding the end-to-end processes for maintaining customer master and product data across the organization.
* Defines, designs, and builds data quality controls to proactively identify data integrity issues.
* Perform ad hoc customer, vendor and product master data requests

**POSITION QUALIFICATIONS**

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Establishes good working relationships with business owners, and supporting the governance structure to ensure on-going data accuracy and completeness.
* Good skills in data administration, design, and architecture.
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Experience working with company hardware and software products to make sound financial recommendations.

**Knowledge:** Acquired through education, certifications, training, experience.

* Proficiency in MS Office Applications required, (especially Excel)

**Level of Experience:**

* Five or more years of experience in data analysis or computer programming.
* Experience working with industry standards, regulations, and guidelines in database warehousing and other relevant systems.


**Level of Education:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Bachelor's degree in information science, data management, computer science or related field preferred.

**Travel:**

* Travel not required.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBLITIES**


The core tasks, duties, and responsibilities that must be performed on the job.

* Ensures quality of master data in key systems, as well as development and documentation of processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance and data integrity.
* Identifies areas for data quality improvements and helps to resolve data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies.
* In collaboration with subject matter experts and data stewards, defines and implements data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure AirLife's data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.
* Provides assistance in resolving data quality problems through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies collaborating with subject matter experts (SMEs).
* Manages, analyzes, and resolves data initiative issues and manages revisions needed to best meet internal and customer requirements while adhering to published data standards.

**OTHER RESPONSIBLITIES**

* Focus on achieving our Company mission
* Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness in daily work; look for ways to improve and promote quality & safety.
* Inspire the trust of others; treat people with respect and dignity and embrace the value of diversity.
* Use time efficiently; perform job accurately, thoroughly, and conserve Company resources to improve profits.
* Contribute to building and maintaining a positive team environment.
* Assure all policies and guidelines are implemented and followed.

**QUALITY POLICY**


At AirLife, Quality is our promise. It is our commitment to customer satisfaction and our dedication to product excellence in an evolving global healthcare market. This promise is kept through a continuously improving and effective Quality Management System and compliance to Regulatory Requirements.

**DEIA STATEMENT**


At AirLife, we are committed to building a diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace that reflects the communities and customers we serve. We believe our philosophy on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Advancement (DEIA) encourages excellence and equips us to serve an evolving global marketplace.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Description: ***Are you ready to dive into the exhilarating world of data and insights?***


Join our dynamic startup team as a Data Analyst and be at the forefront of transforming raw data into game-changing insights for our valued customers. We're not just offering a job – we're offering the chance to shape the future of data analytics.

**Role Overview:** As a Data Analyst at Amped Data Solutions, you won't just be crunching numbers; you'll be crafting narratives that drive organizational success. Your knack for turning data into actionable insights and your mastery of cutting-edge tools like Power BI will make you a key player in our customer's journey towards data-driven decisions.

**Responsibilities:**

* Immerse yourself in our customer's world, understanding their needs and translating them into a visionary data model that unveils the hidden stories within raw data.
* Channel your creativity and technical prowess to craft captivating dashboards and interactive visual reports using the power of Power BI.
* Be the visionary that identifies the North Stars of data – the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that will light the way to success. Keep a watchful eye on these metrics, guiding our customers toward their goals.
* Transform data insights into a compelling narrative, using your critical thinking to not only identify patterns but also explain their impact.
* Bridge the gap between business and technology by translating complex requirements into technical specs, delivering reports that empower swift decision-making.
* Construct data relationships like a maestro, composing harmonious tabular and multi-dimensional data models that resonate with precision.
* Document your analytics symphonies, recording the algorithms, models, and data relationships orchestrating the brilliance of Power BI reports.
* Keep your SQL skills finely tuned, crafting and refining queries that unearth the treasures hidden within relational databases.


Requirements: **Key Skills:**

* A fervent passion for the artistry of data analytics – you see data as your canvas, and insights as your masterpiece.
* The ability to work magic with data and communicate its wizardry to even the most non-technical minds.
* You've spent 3 or more years honing your craft, dancing in the realm of BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, and beyond.
* With 2 or more years under your belt, SQL queries are your linguistic playground – you know just how to coax insights from data-rich domains.

**Why Join Us:** Be a part of something from the ground up. We don't just embrace innovation; we embody it. Join a team that doesn't just analyze data – we infuse it with imagination, turning it into the driving force behind organizational success. Your role isn't just a job; it's a chance to shape a revolution in data analytics.

***If you're ready to harness your analytical prowess and shape the future of data-driven decision-making, apply now to embark on this exhilarating journey with us. Your adventure starts here.***

title: NPI - Junior Data Analyst
description:
**Position Title:** Junior Data Analyst
---------------------------------------

**Minimum Education and Experience:** Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of relevant experience  

**Substitutions and Equivalents:** Master’s degree and 2 years of relevant experience.  

**Anticipated Start Date:** March 12, 2024 or March 19, 2024  

**Project:** Partnerships Incubator  

**Location:** Virtual  

**Level of Effort:** Part-time Consultancy (Total number of hours will depend on the periods of performance and scopes of work assigned)  

**Project Director:** Donna Vincent Roa, Ph.D., ABC, CDPMⓇ

**About Kaizen**
----------------


Kaizen, A Tetra Tech Company, is an incubator for innovative, scalable solutions that address emerging market challenges and opportunities. Our proven solutions catalyze locally driven, organizational, and institutional performance improvements and shift the development model into one that is bottom-up and ongoing. We leverage existing knowledge, new technologies, and innovative business models.


Kaizen is hiring a highly motivated professional looking to create a social impact in a fast-paced and rewarding work environment. We seek applications for the **Junior Data Analyst** position for the USAID-funded Partnerships Incubator. This five-year project started in October 2019 and ends on September 30, 2024.

**About the Partnerships Incubator**
------------------------------------


USAID aims to diversify its partner base by removing barriers to engagement and creating avenues for new and nontraditional partners to work with the Agency. The Partnerships Incubator was set up as a global service hub to address this need by amplifying USAID’s external communications efforts to strengthen and diversify the Agency’s partner base, expanding Agency capacity for partnerships, and supporting partner organizations working with USAID.


The Partnerships Incubator works with USAID headquarters and Missions to identify and engage new and local partners, provide training and capacity-strengthening assistance, and develop tools, resources, and models to advance USAID’s partnership goals. The project also designed, developed, and launched WorkwithUSAID.org, a free, USAID-funded resource hub designed to connect partners to peers and experts, improve their organizational readiness, and prepare them to receive USAID funding.

**Position Overview**
---------------------


The **Junior Data Analyst** will support an approximately six week activity in support of the US Agency for International Development’s Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance Bureau (DRG). Collaborating with a team of researchers, the Junior Data Analyst may help design questions for surveys and key informant interviews, clean and analyze data, draw key insights, and develop visualizations to support the presentation of the data to USAID.

**Principal Responsibilities**
------------------------------

* Collaborate with the team to develop data collection protocols.
* Inform approaches to data collection and maintenance that align with project goals.
* Support the development of research questions.
* Track, categorize, and clean incoming data.
* Analyze incoming data to draw key insights.
* Develop visualizations to support the presentation of data.
* Ensure data accuracy and integrity in the analysis.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams on data-related projects.
* Other related duties, as assigned.

**Qualifications**
------------------

* Bachelor’s degree and five years of relevant experience, OR Master’s degree and 2 years of relevant experience.
* Proven experience in data collection, analysis, management, and visualization.
* Ability to extract actionable insights from complex data sets.
* Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
* Knowledge of data collection and research methodologies.
* Adaptability to evolving data analysis technologies and trends.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work in multiple cultures, highly motivated, self-starting, intellectually curious, flexible, a passion for learning, and deeply committed to social impact.
* Knows the importance and relevance of taking initiative and being a problem solver.
* Strong interest and ability to deliver innovative solutions.
* Effective communication and presentation skills.
* Collaborative mindset and ability to work in cross-functional teams.
* Strong interest and experience in international development.
* Experience with USAID programs is a plus.
* Spanish, French, or Arabic language skills are a plus.


Qualified applicants should send a **resume/CV with a well-written cover letter** (let your writing skills shine – please delight us).


Applicants must submit all requirements to be considered for the position, including a resume, cover letter, and a pre-engagement questionnaire which will be shared by email. The deadline to submit is 11:59 p.m. on March 5, 2024. We intend to hold interviews on a rolling basis.


No phone calls, please. Only finalists will be contacted.


The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified.

*Please note: All current employees are contracted through September 2024. The stated term of employment is aligned with the fifth year of our contract.*

 **For candidates applying for positions based in Kaizen's office in Washington, DC, we utilize career.place to mitigate bias in the recruitment process. Upon submitting an application, candidates will receive an email from career.place, prompting them to go through the anonymous screening. In order to be considered for a role, candidates must respond to career.place and proceed with the application. We do not currently use career.place for project positions outside of the United States.**


At Kaizen, A Tetra Tech Company, we find strength in our diversity. We are committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive working environment in which everyone has an equal opportunity to fulfill their potential. We know that we can only do development differently if we are open to and inclusive of new and unique perspectives. We encourage candidates of all abilities, ages, gender identities and expressions, national origins, races and ethnicities, religious beliefs, and sexual orientations to apply. Further, we urge parents and non-parents, married and unmarried, those from different or non-traditional educational backgrounds, and persons of all other diverse identities or experiences to apply. Kaizen is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Product Owner/Business Analyst
description:
**About Us:**

MedEdge Solutions is an emerging startup dedicated to revolutionizing healthcare through technology. Our mission is to develop ancillary software which improves patient outcomes, enhances healthcare provider capabilities, and make healthcare more accessible. We are passionate about making a meaningful impact on the lives of patients and healthcare professionals around the world.

**Job Summary:**

We are looking for an innovative and proactive Product Owner to join our development team. As a Product Owner, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between complex healthcare needs and technology solutions. You will be responsible for crafting the product vision, prioritizing the product backlog, and ensuring our solutions meet the high standards required in the healthcare industry. Your work will directly contribute to improving healthcare experiences and outcomes for patients globally.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and articulate a compelling product vision that aligns with our mission to transform healthcare through technology.
* Manage the product backlog, prioritizing features and requirements based on value, impact, and strategic goals.
* Collaborate closely with healthcare professionals, and internal teams to understand and anticipate user needs, translating them into product features.
* Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and standards (e.g., HIPAA, HITRUST) throughout the product development process.
* Facilitate agile ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospectives, daily stand-ups) to keep the development team aligned and focused on the most critical tasks.
* Utilize data and user feedback to guide product development decisions, continually seeking ways to improve patient care and user experience.
* Work with marketing, sales, and customer support to successfully launch new features and ensure ongoing support and user satisfaction.
* Stay informed about healthcare industry trends, technological advancements, and competitive landscape to keep the product relevant and innovative.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business, or related field.
* 3+ years experience in product management or ownership, preferably in the healthcare technology sector.
* Strong understanding of software development methodologies.
* Knowledge of healthcare regulations and standards affecting software development.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical teams and healthcare professionals.
* Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making.
* Passion for healthcare innovation and a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
* Understanding of technology concepts and frameworks such as APIs, RPA, ETLs, etc.

**What We Offer:**

* The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing startup with a mission to transform healthcare.
* A culture that values innovation, collaboration, and a client-centric approach to product development.
* Competitive salary.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Professional development opportunities in a rapidly evolving industry.

title: Data Quality Analyst
description:
Data Entry Specialist - US Based

SparkAI is looking for Data Entry Specialists to assist with day to day operations for a 5-week contract engagement. The work schedule is highly flexible and you will be able to build your schedule each week by choosing from shifts published on the company’s scheduling platform.

This position has a weekly cap on hours set to 10. Scheduling is highly flexible and you are able to add or drop 1-hour shifts at any point up to an hour before the start time of a shift.

Your role will be to inspect a series of images or videos, and provide annotations or answer questions on the content you see. In some instances, you may need to provide labels or comments to the media you are reviewing. You will use a web based application to provide feedback and annotations on images.

In this role, you will remain available to rapidly respond to a high volume of images, with the goal of providing accurate annotations to each image in a timely manner.

As a Data Entry Specialist, you will:

* Apply standard labeling practices to ambiguous data
* Analyze pictures, videos, or text and provide commentary, corrections and additional information to the images using the SparkAI application
* Review and provide feedback on a high volume of images within a set window of time
* Provide general feedback to the SparkAI team when applicable
* Train to work on multiple programs for which different labeling criteria will apply

As a Data Entry Specialist, you are:

* Comfortable in a high volume, quick response time environment
* Hyper focused on the details
* Interested in emerging technologies
* Able to learn and adapt on the fly
* Skilled at learning new concepts quickly

This includes producing various reports on academic performance, outcome assessment, program evaluation, and program accreditation. Responsible for generating standard and ad hoc reports and providing data in compliance with governing bodies: federal and state governmental and accrediting agencies.


This position is full-time and the schedule will be Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

**Position Qualifications:**


A Bachelor's degree is required in Business, Statistics, Information Management, Business Analytics, or Psychology. A Master's degree is preferred. One to three years of experience in data analysis and data mining and experience extracting, managing, manipulating, and reporting using large data sets. Higher education or other educational setting experience is preferred.

**Additional skills:**

* Ability to use Microsoft Office Suite
* Advanced Excel Skills (e.g., Vlookup, Hlookup, pivot tables, formulas, graphs and charts).
* Demonstrated understanding of relational databases, and experience with programmable software (e.g., Access and SPSS) to perform statistical tests including correlation analysis, One-Way ANOVA, linear regression, etc.
* Experience with survey and assessment instruments such as SurveyMonkey.
* Strong oral and written communication skills are necessary to relay data issues and data analysis findings in an organized and easily understandable fashion.
* Excellent organizational skills with a keen orientation to detail, deadline, as well as the ability to prioritize multiple deadlines.
* Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills.

*Northwestern Health Sciences University is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected category including disability and protected veteran status.*
